contest-event.event-date:
May 30, 1931 D Maryhill (Glasgow) Contest
Maryhill (Glasgow) Contest 0 Own Choice Test Piece Contest
maryhill-glasgow-contest
Firhill Park, Maryhill, Glasgow March Contest Also Held, with set test "The Scottish Hiker's Song". March contest adjudicator was A. H. Muddiman. 1st Prize - Rothwell Temperance (£3) 2nd Prize - St. Hilda's (£2) 3rd Prize - Carlisle St. Stephen's 4th Prize - Luton Red Cross
Prizes for the own choice test piece contest were:
1st - £100 and Challenge Cup 2nd - £60 3rd - £40 4th - £25 5th - £15 6th - £10
At 5pm there was an interval for 20 minutes. The massed bands gave a concert at this point for broadcast on the BBC. Programme was conducted by Herbert Bennett and featured:
1. March - "Song Of The Guards" - Dave Comer (from the film "The Yellow Mask") 2. Entr'acte - "Bells at Eventide" - S. Cope 3. March - "The Song Of Glasgow" - H. Bennett (The Glasgow Evening News Prize Song)
Nov. 27, 2011, 11:17 a.m. Nov. 27, 2011, 11:35 a.m.
